page.title: 11A FARMER'S YEAR (3)
page.content: AUGUST:You combine the corn and bale the straw and then cover and secure the bales for the winter. SEPTEMBER:You cultivate the fields for next year's crop,which means you plough the fields so you can sow the seeds for next year.Then you dig up the potatoes to eat. OCTOBER:In October you sow the corn and fertize it,spray it with pesticides to kill the bugs that might ruin the crop. NOVEMBER:In November you put the ram in with the ewes so they can mate,so that the ewes can have lambs in the spring.Also you have to get the sheds ready for the winter. DECEMBER:You put the cattle in the sheds for winter and spread the manure,and drench the cattle ,and do some hedgecutting.Sometimes the cattle have to go to market.The local markets are at Banbury,Bicester and Brackley.
